full_summary:
# Inductively Coupled Plasma - Optical Emission Spectrometer (ICP-OES) Tender Announcement

### Tender Details

*   Reference Number: PW-23-01030075
*   Solicitation Number: 5000068560R
*   Publication Date: 2023-03-15
*   Tender Closing Date: 2023-03-29T14:00:00 (expired)

### Tender Category

*   GSIN (Global Supply Network): N6640 - Laboratory Equipment and Supplies
*   UNSPSC (United Nations Standard Products and Services Code): None

### Tender Description

The Emergencies Science and Technology Section (ESTS) of Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) is seeking to purchase an Inductively Coupled Plasma - Optical Emission Spectrometer (ICP-OES) with axial and radial view for the quantitative analysis of multiple trace elements in environmental, geochemical, and petrochemical samples. The primary use of this instrument will be to conduct research into the analysis of multiple trace elements in crude oils and petroleum oil products following ASTM D5708 Test Method A or ASTM D7691.

Estimated quantity of commodity: 1. Duration of contract: 2023-04-01 to 2024-03-31. Time frame of delivery: 2023-04-30. No specific conditions for supplier participation are mentioned.

### Contracting Entity Information

*   Contracting Entity Name: Environment and Climate Change Canada
*   Contact Information:
    *   Name: Kassandra Lauzier
    *   Email: kassandra.lauzier@ec.gc.ca
    *   Phone: 438-801-0827

### Related Trade Agreements

This tender announcement falls under the following trade agreements:

*   Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
*   Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
*   Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
*   Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
*   Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement

### Document Attachment

For further details, please refer to the attached notice document from the Canada Buys website: [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2023/03/15/12641eebfa93da3a9c8b2372e2f690ca/500006
